00019 #include "receiver.h"
00020 
00021 void *s_lithreadstart(void* vid)
00022 {
00023         ((Receiver*)vid)->threadstart();
00024         return NULL;
00025 }
00026 
00027 
00028 Receiver::Receiver(Sequencer *seq)
00029 {
00030         sequencer=seq;
00031         id=0;
00032         sock=0;
00033         alive=false;
00034 }
00035 
00036 Receiver::~Receiver(void)
00037 {
00038         stop();
00039 }
00040 
00041 void Receiver::reset(int pos, SWInetSocket *socky)
00042 {
00043         if (alive)
00044         {
00045                 logmsgf(LOG_ERROR,"Whoa, receiver is still alive!");
00046                 return;
00047         }
00048         id=pos;
00049         sock=socky;
00050         alive=true;
00051         //start a listener thread
00052         pthread_create(&thread, NULL, s_lithreadstart, this);
00053 }
00054 
00055 void Receiver::stop()
00056 {
00057         //pthread_cancel(thread);
00058         //pthread_join(thread, NULL);
00059         alive=false;
00060 }
00061 
00062 void Receiver::threadstart()
00063 {
00064         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Receive thread %d started", id);
00065         //get the vehicle description
00066         int type;
00067         unsigned int source;
00068         unsigned int len;
00069         
00070         //security fix: we limit the size of the vehicle name to 128 characters <- from Luigi Auriemma
00071         if (Messaging::receivemessage(sock, &type, &source, &len, dbuffer, 128)) {
00072                 sequencer->disconnect(id, "Messaging abuse 1");
00073                 pthread_exit(NULL);
00074         }
00075         
00076         if (type!=MSG2_USE_VEHICLE) {
00077                 sequencer->disconnect(id, "Protocol error 1");
00078                 pthread_exit(NULL);
00079         }
00080         //security
00081         dbuffer[len]=0;
00082         //we queue the use vehicle message for others
00083         sequencer->queueMessage(id, type, dbuffer, len);
00084         //get the buffer size, not really usefull but a good way to detect errors
00085         if (Messaging::receivemessage(sock, &type, &source, &len, dbuffer, 4)) {
00086                 sequencer->disconnect(id, "Messaging abuse 2"); 
00087                 pthread_exit(NULL);
00088         }
00089         
00090         if (type!=MSG2_BUFFER_SIZE) {
00091                 sequencer->disconnect(id, "Protocol error 2");
00092                 pthread_exit(NULL);
00093         }
00094         unsigned int buffersize=*((unsigned int*)dbuffer);
00095         if (buffersize>MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH) {
00096                 sequencer->disconnect(id, "Memory error from client");
00097                 pthread_exit(NULL);
00098         }
00099         //notify the client of all pre-existing vehicles
00100         sequencer->notifyAllVehicles(id);
00101         //okay, we are ready, we can receive data frames
00102         sequencer->enableFlow(id);
00103         logmsgf(LOG_DEBUG,"Slot %d is switching to FLOW", id);
00104         while (1)
00105         {
00106                 if (Messaging::receivemessage(sock, &type, &source, &len, dbuffer, MAX_MESSAGE_LENGTH)) {
00107                         sequencer->disconnect(id, "Game connection closed");
00108                         pthread_exit(NULL);
00109                 }
00110                 if (type!=MSG2_VEHICLE_DATA && type!=MSG2_CHAT && type!=MSG2_FORCE) {
00111                         sequencer->disconnect(id, "Protocol error 3");
00112                         pthread_exit(NULL);
00113                 }
00114                 sequencer->queueMessage(id, type, dbuffer, len);
00115         }
00116         pthread_exit(NULL);
00117 }
